vp.jersey.rest

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • vp.jersey.rest.Server

  • @Path(value="/api")
public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    Path domain/disc/*. All API requests are in this class.

      • printAPIintro

        @GET
 @Produces(value="text/html")
public java.lang.String printAPIintro()
        Prints API intro.
        Returns:
        Hello message as HTML.

      • addRoundScore

        @Path(value="/addroundscore")
 @POST
 @Produces(value="text/html")
 @Consumes(value="application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addRoundScore(@FormParam(value="scores")
                                                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String scoresCSV,
                                                                                                                                                                            @FormParam(value="courseID")
                                                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String courseID)
        HTTP POST-request that adds round scores to the system. Returns a HTTP Response.
        Parameters:
        scoresCSV - Player scores for the round as a comma-separated-values list in format "playerID:[array of scores];". For example "45:3,3,4,3,4,3,3,4,3;46:3,2,4,5,4,7,3,4,2;".
        courseID - ID for the course the round was played on.
        Returns:
        HTTP response with appropriate status.

      • addDiscCaddyCSVScoreCard

        @Path(value="/add_dc_csv_score")
 @POST
 @Produces(value="text/html")
 @Consumes(value="application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addDiscCaddyCSVScoreCard(@FormParam(value="date")
                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String dateStr,
                                                                                                                                                                                          @FormParam(value="scores")
                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String scoresCsv,
                                                                                                                                                                                          @FormParam(value="courseID")
                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String courseID)
        HTTP POST-request that adds a Disc Caddy 2 CSV-file scorecard to the system. Was used to import previous round data for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        dateStr - The date when the round was played. "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss".
        courseID - ID for the course the round was played on.
        scoresCsv - The scores copied from the CSV-file.
        Returns:
        HTTP response with appropriate status.

      • getRound

        @Path(value="/round")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getRound(@QueryParam(value="id")
                                                                                                              java.lang.Integer roundID)
        HTTP GET-request that returns round by ID as a JSON object.
        Parameters:
        roundID - The requested round ID.
        Returns:
        HTTP response with appropriate round and status.

      • getRounds

        @Path(value="/rounds")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getRounds()
        HTTP GET-request that returns all rounds in database as a JSON list of objects.
        Returns:
        HTTP response with appropriate round list and status.

      • addPlayer

        @Path(value="/addplayer")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="text/html")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addPlayer(@QueryParam(value="name")
                                                                                                            java.lang.String name)
        HTTP GET-request that adds a player to the database.
        Parameters:
        name - Name for the new player.
        Returns:
        HTTP response with appropriate round list and status.

      • addCourse

        @Path(value="/addcourse")
 @POST
 @Produces(value="text/html")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addCourse(@FormParam(value="name")
                                                                                                             java.lang.String name,
                                                                                                             @FormParam(value="location")
                                                                                                             java.lang.String location,
                                                                                                             @FormParam(value="holes")
                                                                                                             java.lang.String holes)
        HTTP POST-request that adds a course to the database.
        Parameters:
        name - Name for the new course.
        location - Location for the new course.
        holes - Holes for the new course. Have to be given in proper CSV format. "par,length;par,length;par,length;par,length; ..." for example "3,74;3,94;3,74;3,70;3,85;3,74;3,49;3,55;3,49;".
        Returns:
        HTTP response with appropriate round list and status.

      • getPlayers

        @Path(value="/players")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getPlayers()
        HTTP GET-request that returns all players as a JSON list of objects.
        Returns:
        HTTP response with appropriate status.

        Returns:
